segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: To recover a corrupted drive protected by BitLocker, a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Help Desk user will need to create a recovery key package file.
segment.target: To recover a corrupted drive protected by BitLocker, a Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) Help Desk user will need to create a recovery key package file.

segment.source: This package file can then be copied to the computer that contains the corrupted drive, and then used to recover the drive.
segment.target: This package file can then be copied to the computer that contains the corrupted drive, and then used to recover the drive.

segment.source: Use the following procedure for the steps needed to do this.
segment.target: Use the following procedure for the steps needed to do this.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: To avoid a potential loss of data, it is strongly recommended that you read the “repair-bde” help and clearly understand how to use the command before completing the following instructions.
segment.target: To avoid a potential loss of data, it is strongly recommended that you read the “repair-bde” help and clearly understand how to use the command before completing the following instructions.

segment.source: To recover a corrupted drive
segment.target: To recover a corrupted drive

segment.source: To create the recovery key package necessary to recover a corrupted drive, start a web browser and open the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.
segment.target: To create the recovery key package necessary to recover a corrupted drive, start a web browser and open the MBAM Administration and Monitoring website.

segment.source: Select Drive Recovery from the left navigation pane.
segment.target: Select Drive Recovery from the left navigation pane.

segment.source: Enter the user’s domain name, user name, reason for unlocking the drive, and the user’s recovery password ID.
segment.target: Enter the user’s domain name, user name, reason for unlocking the drive, and the user’s recovery password ID.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are a member of the Help Desk Administrators role, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.
segment.target: If you are a member of the Help Desk Administrators role, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.

segment.source: Click Submit.
segment.target: Click Submit.

segment.source: The recovery key will be displayed.
segment.target: The recovery key will be displayed.

segment.source: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.
segment.target: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.

segment.source: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.
segment.target: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.

segment.source: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files box.
segment.target: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files box.

segment.source: Right-click cmd.exe and select Run as Administrator.
segment.target: Right-click cmd.exe and select Run as Administrator.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace fixed drive with an available hard disk drive that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Replace fixed drive with an available hard disk drive that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified hard disk drive.
segment.target: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified hard disk drive.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Performing BitLocker Management with MBAM
